intro: Hieracium leucothyrsogenes, commonly known as the white thyrsocephalum hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, preferring moist, nutrient-rich soils. It features a basal rosette of leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many regions.
